articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces deepened their incursion into two northern and southern areas of the Gaza Strip on Friday, and Palestinian health officials said tank shelling in Rafah killed at least 11 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces push deeper into southern and northern Gaza

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote for a new president on Friday following Ebrahim Raisi's death in a helicopter crash, choosing from a tightly controlled group of four candidates loyal to the supreme leader, at a time of growing public frustration.
articles.title: Iran holds presidential vote with limited choices

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has yet to name a permanent replacement for the global body's aid chief who departs for health reasons on Friday, drawing criticism at a time of record global needs.
articles.title: UN aid chief succession in focus amid exploding humanitarian crises

articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Aditi Shah
articles.description: Heavy rainfall and winds brought down a roof at the main airport in New Delhi on Friday, killing one person and disrupting flights from a domestic terminal, while flooded streets and traffic snarls threw daily life out of gear in India's capital.
articles.title: Roof collapse at Delhi airport kills one, as heavy rain disrupts Indian capital

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: France's far-right National Rally (RN) extended its lead in a poll published on the last day of campaigning before Sunday's first round of parliamentary elections, with another survey showing it in sight of a slim majority.
articles.title: French far-right extends poll lead as campaign ends

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: After their stunning success forcing the government to shelve $2.7 billion in tax hikes, young Kenyan activists are setting their sights higher, taking aim at deeply ingrained corruption and misgovernance.
articles.title: After dramatic tax win, Kenyan protesters plot next moves

articles.author: Minwoo Park
articles.description: South Koreans Kim Eun-ha and Park Cho-hyeon would like to get married and have children, a plan that fits in with government ambitions to boost the world's lowest fertility rate.
articles.title: As South Korea's population shrinks, same-sex couples say they can help

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte, who will be NATO's next secretary-general, was criticised by other European Union leaders at a summit for his opposition to joint EU funding of defence projects, Poland's prime minister said on Friday.
articles.title: Poland's Tusk says EU leaders criticised next NATO boss Rutte

articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: Laughing and joking, Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un cruised around Pyongyang last week in a Russian-made Aurus limousine to showcase their strengthened anti-Western alliance.
articles.title: Exclusive: Firm making car that Putin gifted to Kim uses South Korean parts, data shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lawyers for rights groups asked a Hague court on Friday to order the Dutch state to block all exports of F-35 fighter jet parts which might end up in Israel, including parts sent to the United States to build fighter planes destined for the Israeli army.
articles.title: NGOs seek Dutch export ban for jet parts that may go to Israel
